Ya but you are kidding yourself if you think tank yasuo and tank ekko build bruiser. They can pretty much go full tank and abuse base damage and keystones. A bruiser is a champ like wukong that usually builds 2 or 3 damage items and a couple tanky items and relies in innate survivablity.

A character is not defined as a bruiser based on his items, what defines its classification is the play style that the champion presents, bruisers are off-tanks damage dealers whose job can range from initiator to divers and each champion can build it their own way to accomplish said goals,  which is why you have Wukong building mostly full damage and Hecarim with a single trinity force doing the exact same thing (jumping on the back line and disrupting them, while also being capable of starting fights on their own), then you have champions like Irelia, Olaf and Vladimir, whose job is to follow up on a engage to eliminate high threat targets, and while the 3 of them do the same thing, Irelia accomplishes it with a single trinity force,  while Olaf doesn't even need a single damaging item and Vladimir is building Ap, so no Yasuo and Ekko are not tanks, they are bruisers that require very few damaging items to be effective, (Yasuo is arguable since his core items are phantom dancer and frozen mallet, two very combat focused items), if you consider Ekko a tank just because of his build, then you should also include Irelia on that list, because their build path is extremely similar. There are no "tank" items in the game, there are only offensive items, defensive items and utility items.
